meanings.definition: A particular form of a language that is peculiar to a specific region or social group.
meanings.sent1: In some areas, people speak different dialects that can be hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: The dialects spoken in the southern states of the country have unique phrases and pronunciations.
meanings.sent3: When visiting the small town, I was amused by the local dialects used by the residents.
meanings.sent4: The dialects of the fishermen were like a secret code only they could decipher.
meanings.sent5: The variety of dialects in the country made communication between regions challenging.

meanings.definition: The language of a particular region, class, or group of persons.
meanings.sent1: The dialects of the city dwellers differed greatly from those of the rural population.
meanings.sent2: She found it fascinating how dialects could change so much in just a few miles.
meanings.sent3: The dialects of the teenagers were full of slang and inside jokes.
meanings.sent4: His dialects were like a map, revealing where he grew up and who he associated with.
meanings.sent5: The rich history of the region could be heard in the dialects of the elderly residents.
